In 2022 Bad Boy Mowers kicked off its sponsorship of the Pinstripe Bowl in this stadium that's a bit better known for baseball
The 2021 TransPerfect Music City Bowl was held in this city, y'all
California's state fabric is this jeans material that became a hit in the gold rush
Also the name of a famous boat, it's fitting that this is the state flower of Massachusetts
The state mammal of Nebraska is the white-tailed this
A state sport of Colorado involves racing these small donkeys
Laissez les bon temps rouler with this treat, Louisiana's state doughnut

clues.text: In the first chapter of "A Christmas Carol", this word is used 8 times; in the last chapter, not at all
In business it's the opposite of a deficit
4-letter word for the heart of the matter, the central, critical point
"Up to" this means "in good shape", not ready for some tobacco
It describes a hero who receives no praise, in music or otherwise
Christopher Robin joined Pooh & friends for new adventures in a 2009 authorized sequel called "Return to" this wood
"Insurgent" is Book 2 in this dystopian series
"'Tis" was Frank McCourt's follow-up to this Pulitzer-winning memoir about his impoverished upbringing in Ireland
It's the fitting 2-word title of Jojo Moyes' sequel to "Me Before You", about Louisa Clark following the death of Will Traynor

rounds.comments: (Ken: Each correct response is two words; one has the letter I, the other does not.)

clues.text: If an I gets poked out, one who gets property in a will becomes a third person pronoun
To relinquish certain rights, & how you can say goodbye to those rights after the I leaves
You "show" this when you maintain composure; when I leaves, you "strike" this second word when your picture is taken
Make an I disappear & presto! A mental picture becomes an olden word for a wizard
Without an I, an adjective describing a shade like indigo becomes an action that shades you crimson

rounds.category: THE SURPRISINGLY SUCCESSFUL LEAGUE OF NATIONS

clues.text: In the early 1920s the League managed to get more than 400,000 of these from 26 countries repatriated from foreign captivity
The League's health section helped standardize vaccines for diphtheria, tuberculosis & this, also known as lockjaw
The League oversaw the 1925 ban on poison gas & bacteriological warfare, better known as this Swiss city's protocol
In 1925 the League headed off a Balkan war between Bulgaria & this neighbor to the south
In 1921 the League averted war between Finland & this nation over control of the Åland Islands in the Gulf of Bothnia
